content.text: The figure below is made up of square ABDE and triangle CDE. The area of square ABDE is $64 \text{ cm}^2$ and the height of triangle CDE is $20 \text{ cm}$. Find the area of the shaded triangle CBD. [Diagram: A composite geometric figure is shown, consisting of a square ABDE and a triangle CDE. The vertices are labeled A, B, C, D, E. Square ABDE is on the left. Triangle CDE extends to the right and upwards from the base DE. A vertical dashed line extends from C downwards to the line containing DE, forming a right angle, and its length is labeled as 20 cm, representing the height of triangle CDE. The triangle CBD is shaded.]
content.text_latex: The figure below is made up of square ABDE and triangle CDE. The area of square ABDE is $64 \text{ cm}^2$ and the height of triangle CDE is $20 \text{ cm}$. Find the area of the shaded triangle CBD.

diagrams.alt_text: A composite geometric figure consisting of a square ABDE and a triangle CDE. The square ABDE has vertices A, B, D, E. Point C is located such that triangle CDE is formed. A vertical dashed line from C to the line containing DE indicates the height of triangle CDE, which is labeled as 20 cm. A right angle symbol is shown at the base of this height. The triangle CBD, formed by vertices C, B, and D, is shaded.

A vertical dashed line from C to the line containing DE indicates the height of triangle CDE, which is labeled as 20 cm. A right angle symbol is shown at the base of this height. The triangle CBD, formed by vertices C, B, and D, is shaded.
